colors.name: Yellow
colors.usage: Yellow can be used for highlights or to draw attention.

colors.name: Black
colors.usage: Black is for headlines and main text.

colors.name: Light Grey
colors.usage: Light Grey works well as backgrounds or accents.

fonts.name: Akzidenz-Grotesk
fonts.description: Berthold first published Akzidenz-Grotesk in 1896. The design originates from Royal Grotesk light by Ferdinand Theinhardt who also supplied the regular, medium and bold weights.
fonts.usage: Use this for headings and titles to keep the brand bold and modern.

fonts.name: Bitter
fonts.description: Sol Matas designed Bitter for comfortably reading on any computer or device.
fonts.usage: For any web content, this ensures easy readability.

fonts.name: Merriweather
fonts.description: Merriweather is a workhorse text type family made specifically for screens. Print use was not a significant consideration in the design.
fonts.usage: This is perfect for longer text sections like reports or newsletters.

fonts.name: Montserrat
fonts.description: Montserrat was created by Julieta Ulanovsky, inspired by the signage and posters of the Montserrat neighborhood in Buenos Aires.
fonts.usage: Use Montserrat for headings, navigation, or other display purposes where a clean, modern, and highly legible sans-serif is needed. It pairs well with serif body fonts like Merriweather for contrast.

fonts.name: Verdana
fonts.description: System font available on most devices.
fonts.usage: Use this font as a backup for email, forms, or anything digital where you can't access the primary fonts.

spaces: Asian Pacific Islander Student Resource Center

Forest Lounge (Faces Streetside, near 'Possibilities are Endless' Banner)
